title: Principles of respiratory mechanics. Part II
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Anatomy
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Body, Human
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Lungs
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Respiratory organs
description: Uses both normal subjects and patients with asthma, pulmonary fibrosis, and emphysema, and respiratory muscle paralysis to illustrate alterations in the mechanics of breathing produced by disease. Using modes and animated drawings, illustrates pulmonary subdivision, explains the work of breathing, and points out the value of mechanical measurements.
